cons: Strawberries Oxalates. Strawberries contain measurable amounts of oxalates. Oxalates should not be eaten in high concentration as they can crystallize and cause kidney or gallbladder problems. Individuals with already existing and untreated kidney or gallbladder problems may want to avoid eating strawberries.
description: The fruit is rich in the B-complex group of vitamins. It contains good amounts of vitamin B-6, niacin, riboflavin, pantothenic acid and folic acid.
These vitamins are acting as co-factors help the body metabolize carbohydrate, proteins, and fats.
They contain a good amount of minerals like potassium, manganese, fluorine, copper, iron and iodine.
Potassium is an important component of cell and body fluids that helps controlling heart rate and blood pressure.
name: Strawberry
pros: The fruit is rich in the B-complex group of vitamins. It contains good amounts of vitamin B-6, niacin, riboflavin, pantothenic acid and folic acid.
These vitamins are acting as co-factors help the body metabolize carbohydrate, proteins, and fats.
They contain a good amount of minerals like potassium, manganese, fluorine, copper, iron and iodine.
Potassium is an important component of cell and body fluids that helps controlling heart rate and blood pressure.
Strawberry is an excellent source of vitamin C, manganese, and flavonoids.

Strawberry is also very good source of dietary fiber, a good source of folate and potassium, omega-3 fatty acids, magnesium, copper, vitamin B2, vitamin B5, vitamin B6, vitamin K, and small amounts of other healthy minerals.
